item.title: AI Porgram Cores
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

“Broadly, machine learning is the field pertaining to creating a self-developing intelligence, but I think you’ll find that the current state of the art is more-or-less limited to solving logic games. Since we don’t understand consciousness in ourselves, we certainly aren’t imbuing our constructs with it.”
Monty
The thing I was talking about earlier that learns by how other people talk and puts sentences together. It’s far from actual AI, but it’s impressive.

Read full topic

item.title: AI Porgram Cores
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

If you mean an AI like something out of Neuromancer, you’re talking about something that’s far beyond today’s programming capabilities. The best we can really do now is create a semblance of intelligence (actually just very good logic) based on pre-provided knowledge or acquired training.

Broadly, machine learning is the field pertaining to creating a self-developing intelligence, but I think you’ll find that the current state of the art is more-or-less limited to solving logic games. Since we don’t understand consciousness in ourselves, we certainly aren’t imbuing our constructs with it.

That said, I’ve been told that there are bots in development (I’m thinking of one MIT project in particular, can’t remember the name) that are very good at comprehending language against a backdrop of definitions provided by the programmer - which, if you think about, is basically what a developing child is acquiring. It was explained to me that if you told this bot

The girl went to the grocery store.
it could infer that perhaps the girl was hungry, or perhaps she went to buy something for someone else. Maybe she went in a car, but she could have ridden her bike - etc. Essentially they've written a program with situational understanding. I wish I could remember more about this, but it's been a while.

Further reading: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Artificial_intelligence

Read full topic

item.title: AI Porgram Cores
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

If you want to generate a bot that will converse with a user that’s one thing, but coding an application with a “mind of its own” is way beyond most of us…

Anyway, typically a “ai” chat bot contains a database of keywords that help to determine what response to return. The problem is the size of the database required to support a full conversation, as it would require comparing keywords to find the best response match…sorry if that’s a bit vague too, its hard to explain. I’m sure if you ask your friend Google he mind give you some more help on where to start

Read full topic

item.title: AI Porgram Cores
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Quite a vague question. AI can refer to many things: game ai (computer analysis of a scenario to determine the probably best course of action), Q/A ai (like “ai” chats…not really artificial intelligence), strong ai (artificial human-like reasoning skills), computer vision (visual perception for computers), and so on…

Read full topic
